STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
July 27, 2023
Brian E Millikin
MIDLAND/GLADWIN COUNTY DHHS
1509 WASHINGTON ST STE A,
MIDLAND, MI, 48640-5612
Re: License #: CP560201302
Dear Brian E Millikin:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
07/15/2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5060.
Sincerely,
Mark Hunter, Licensing Consultant
enclosure
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12327 Special evaluation
(6) An agency shall do all of the following:
(c) Provide a copy of the report to any social services
worker that has children placed in the home.
Two of the three special evaluation reports reviewed did not include adequate
documentation to determine a copy of the completed special evaluation was
provided to the social worker that had children placed in the home.
CPA Rule 400.12327 Special evaluation
(7) If any violations are cited and there is a signed
corrective action plan, all social service workers who
have children placed in the home shall be notified there
is a corrective action plan and what is required of the
foster parent in that plan.
One of the three special evaluation reports reviewed involved the need for a
corrective action plan. There was inadequate documentation to determine the foster
care worker with children placed in the home was provided a copy of the corrective
action plan that was required.
FOM 722-06 B The DHS-1105, Family Team Meeting Report, is used to
capture family demographics, FTM logistical information,
needs, strengths, action steps, safety concerns and the
2

safety plan, and any recommendations made for the
family during the FTM. The DHS-1105, Family Team
Meeting Report, must be completed for every FTM.
FOM 722-06 B requires appropriate documentation regarding the completion of all
Family Team Meetings that occur. Two of the eight foster child records reviewed
indicated at least one Family Team Meeting was completed and the appropriate
documentation was not located in the information system as required for
compliance. In the first example the youth had a documented FTM completed
6/22/23 and the 1105 associated with this meeting was not located in the
information system. The second example had an FTM completed 11/01/2022 and
there was no 1105 associated with this meeting in the information system.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:.
Technical assistance was provided in a discussion related to special evaluations
and current IT barriers.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• None
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows. The
agency submitted a corrective action plan for the renewal evaluation completed
5/10/2022. Areas identified in noncompliance as a part of the renewal evaluation
were rules 405(5)(a), 418(2)(b), 511(1)(a), and Policy FOM 722-06 B. The CAP
was submitted 5/12/2022 and approved 5/12/2022. The only area identified as a
repeat noncompliance as a part of this interim evaluation is Policy FOM 722-06 B.
3

Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was a review of the agency's progress in
implementing and completing the approved corrective action plan for the renewal
evaluation. An assessment of the agency's Key Performance Indicators was also
included.
Financial Overview
N/A
Staff and Youth Interviews
Child Welfare Staff participated in entrance and exit conferences and no concerns
were reported. Interviews included discussions related to current IT barriers.
Youth interviews were positive and indicated appropriate supervision and services
are being provided.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The building is well maintained and has had some updated furnishings, carpeting,
and room utilization adjustments to improve services. Records were maintained
consistent with licensing requirements.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There was one safety alert involving a relative home. Four issues were related to
the safety alert. The four issues were the improper storage of a firearm, lack of a
guardrail on an upper bunk bed, need for a new mattress for a bed, and getting
clearances/approval for someone as a substitute caretaker. The alert was resolved
12/30/2022, confirmed 1/03/2023, and approved 1/19/2023. Pictures confirmed the
use of a firearm lockbox, and installation of a guardrail and new mattress.
Comments from foster parents, relatives and youth were generally positive and
indicated appropriate services are being provided by the agency.
RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
7/27/2023
________________________________________
Mark Hunter Date
Licensing Consultant
